Class CharacterTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • CharacterTest

  • public class CharacterTest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains all the unit tests related to the character class. Here any functionality related to the characters are tested.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Character char1 
      private Character char2 
      private java.util.ArrayList<Gear> gearList1 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CharacterTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      This is where the object of the character class that needs to be tested is instantiated.
      void testAddGearToChar()
      This JUnit test is used to test if a gear is successfully added to a character or not.
      void testEquipGears()
      This JUnit test is used to test if the character has equipped with all the gears possible from a list of gears given to it.
      void testGetCharName()
      This JUnit test is used to test if the character name is as expected.
      void testGetCharType()
      This JUnit test is used to test if the character type is as expected.
      void testGetEffectiveAttack()
      This JUnit test is used to test if the effective attack points after the character has equipped with all the necessary gears is as expected.
      void testGetEffectiveDefense()
      This JUnit test is used to test if the effective defense points after the character has equipped with all the necessary gears is as expected.
      void testGetGearList()
      This JUnit test is used to test if the characters are correctly equipped with the gears.
      void testInvalidAddGearToChar()
      This JUnit test is used to test if an IllegalStateException is thrown if more gear than the capacity is added to the character.
      void testInvalidReplaceGear1()
      This JUnit test is used to test if the method replaceGear is throwing an IllegalArgumentException when an incorrect index in the character's gear list is given to replace.
      void testInvalidReplaceGear2()
      This JUnit test is used to test if the method replaceGear is throwing an IllegalArgumentException when an incorrect gear Type (not matching with the one present in the given location) is given to replace.
      void testReplaceGear()
      This JUnit test is used to test if the method replaceGear is working as expected.
      void testToString()
      This JUnit test is used to test the toString method of the character class.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        This is where the object of the character class that needs to be tested is instantiated. A character is defined by following properties: 1) Character Name, 2) Character Type, 3) Character's Hit points.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testGetCharName

        public void testGetCharName()
        This JUnit test is used to test if the character name is as expected.

      • testGetCharType

        public void testGetCharType()
        This JUnit test is used to test if the character type is as expected.

      • testGetGearList

        public void testGetGearList()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This JUnit test is used to test if the characters are correctly equipped with the gears.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testGetEffectiveAttack

        public void testGetEffectiveAttack()
        This JUnit test is used to test if the effective attack points after the character has equipped with all the necessary gears is as expected.

      • testGetEffectiveDefense

        public void testGetEffectiveDefense()
        This JUnit test is used to test if the effective defense points after the character has equipped with all the necessary gears is as expected.

      • testAddGearToChar

        public void testAddGearToChar()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This JUnit test is used to test if a gear is successfully added to a character or not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testInvalidAddGearToChar

        public void testInvalidAddGearToChar()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This JUnit test is used to test if an IllegalStateException is thrown if more gear than the capacity is added to the character.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testReplaceGear

        public void testReplaceGear()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This JUnit test is used to test if the method replaceGear is working as expected. This method is used to take an existing uncombined gear from the character's equipped gear list and combine it with the gear that is passed to it (it should be of same type and uncombined). The combined gear will take the place of the gear which was originally present.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testInvalidReplaceGear1

        public void testInvalidReplaceGear1()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This JUnit test is used to test if the method replaceGear is throwing an IllegalArgumentException when an incorrect index in the character's gear list is given to replace.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testInvalidReplaceGear2

        public void testInvalidReplaceGear2()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This JUnit test is used to test if the method replaceGear is throwing an IllegalArgumentException when an incorrect gear Type (not matching with the one present in the given location) is given to replace.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testEquipGears

        public void testEquipGears()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This JUnit test is used to test if the character has equipped with all the gears possible from a list of gears given to it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testToString

        public void testToString()
        This JUnit test is used to test the toString method of the character class.
